com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.base

Class AbstractTheoryWithBinaryAtoms

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.core.constraint.AbstractTheory
      • com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.base.AbstractTheoryWithBinaryAtoms
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Theory, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractTheoryWithBinaryAtomsIncludingEquality

    public abstract class AbstractTheoryWithBinaryAtoms
extends AbstractTheory

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractTheoryWithBinaryAtoms(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> atomFunctors, boolean atomFunctorsAreUniqueToThisTheory)
      Constructor taking the theory's functor strings, a boolean indicating whether any application of this functors, regardless of their arguments types, are to be considered atoms in this theory (for efficiency purposes), and a simplifier for these functions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isAtom(Expression expression, Context context)
      Implements decision of whether an expression is an atom by checking if it is a function application of one of the atom functors and, if so, delegating the decision to applicationOfAtomFunctorIsIndeedAtom(Expression, Context).
      boolean isInterpretedInThisTheoryBesidesBooleanConnectives(Expression expression)
      Indicates whether an expression is an application of a function belonging to this theory, or a constant (including constant functions) belonging to this theory.
